Larangan Cadar dan Celana Cingkrang, Wamenag: Penegakan Disiplin
02 Nov 2019, 23:02 by Fikri Arigi, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Wakil Menteri Agama Zainut Tauhid mengatakan pelarangan penggunaan cadar dan celana cingkrang oleh Aparatur Sipil Negara (ASN) hanya berlaku di lingkungan Kementerian Agama.
“Hal tersebut hanya sebatas untuk penertiban dan penegakan disiplin pegawai di lingkungan Kementerian Agama. Sehingga tidak perlu ditanggapi secara emosional, berlebihan, dan penuh dengan kecurigaan,” kata Zainut dalam keterangan tertulisnya, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
Zainut berpendapat langkah penertiban dan penegakan disiplin seperti itu adalah tindakan yang wajar dan bagian dari tugas pembinaan. Sehingga ASN mematuhi aturan yang ditetapkan. Menurut dia, pelarangan ini tak perlu dikaitkan dengan pelanggaran hak privasi seseorang, apalagi dengan kebebasan beragama.
“Karena dalam penertiban dan penegakan disiplin tersebut dipastikan tidak ada satu pun ajaran agama, hak privasi atau hak asasi seseorang dalam menjalankan ajaran agama yang dilanggar,” kata dia.
Ketentuan seragam ASN, Polri, dan TNI, kata Zainut, sudah ada dan tetap mengindahkan nilai estetika, etika, dan tak bertentangan dengan ajaran agama. Sehingga ketentuan itu harus ditaati oleh semua ASN.
Sebelumnya, Menteri Agama Fachrul Razi mengatakan ASN yang mengenakan celana cingkrang tidak sesuai aturan. Meski tak bisa dipersoalkan dari segi agama, Fachrul menyebut celana cingkrang melanggar aturan berpakaian ASN. “Misal ditegur celana kok tinggi begitu? Kamu enggak lihat aturan negara bagaimana? Kalau enggak bisa ikuti aturan keluar kamu,” kata dia.

Prohibition of Veils and Cingkrang Pants, Deputy Minister of Religion: Discipline Enforcement
02 Nov 2019, 23:02 by Fikri Arigi, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Deputy Minister of Religion Zainut Tauhid said the ban on the use of veils and trousers by the State Civil Service (ASN) only applies within the Ministry of Religion.
"This is only limited to the discipline and enforcement of employee discipline within the Ministry of Religion. So there is no need to respond emotionally, excessively, and full of suspicion, "Zainut said in his written statement, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
Zainut believes such disciplinary measures and enforcement are reasonable actions and part of the task of coaching. So ASN complies with the established rules. According to him, this prohibition need not be linked to violations of one's privacy rights, especially not to freedom of religion.
"Because in the discipline and enforcement of these disciplines it is certain that none of the religious teachings, privacy rights or human rights of a person in carrying out religious teachings are violated," he said.
The provisions of the ASN, Polri and TNI uniforms, said Zainut, already exist and continue to heed the aesthetic, ethical, and not contrary to religious teachings. So that the provisions must be obeyed by all ASNs.
Previously, the Minister of Religion Fachrul Razi said that ASN who wore the pants was not according to the rules. Although it cannot be questioned in terms of religion, Fachrul said the Cingkrang pants violated the ASN dress code. "For example, how come your pants are so tall? You don't see what state rules? If you can't follow your exit rules, "he said.
